title: [Large-Scale] Development of Machine Learning-Based Pedagogy for Metasurface Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamentals of electromagnetics, basic concepts of metamaterials, and introductory machine learning
context.additional_context: Focus on Learning Machine Learning Applications for Metasurface Design in Mathematics Domains. Self-Directed and Collaborative Learning via LMS in BYOD Environments

learning_goals: Learners understand digital coding representations for metasurface design and can classify meta-atom patterns with over 90% accuracy.
Using deep learning neural networks, design accuracy within a 2° error margin in 360° phase response can be achieved.
By applying trained networks, required meta-atom coding patterns can be searched within 1 second from over 10^18 possible combinations.
Learners can explain the design process for implementing three functions (dual-beam/triple-beam diffraction) of anisotropic coding metasurfaces.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
